meanings.definition: A person who takes a contrary position or attitude; specifically : an investor who buys shares of stock when most others are selling and sells when others are buying.
meanings.sent1: John's contrarianism led him to invest in the company when everyone else was selling their shares.
meanings.sent2: Her contrarianism in the stock market often yielded unexpected profits.
meanings.sent3: The contrarianism of the squirrel who saved nuts in summer and ate them in winter was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His contrarianism in the market was like a lone wolf hunting for opportunities in the dark.
meanings.sent5: Contrarianism, the act of going against the crowd in investing, can be a risky but rewarding strategy.
